english: this; thus; such; used in transliteration

etymology.description: semantic: 其 ‘sieve’ + 斤 ‘axe’ → ‘divide/break with an axe’; Xu Shen: synonym of 析; sense preserved in 撕.
etymology.interpretation: A sieve set beside an axe evokes the act of chopping or splitting, yielding the early sense ‘to divide’. The form later broadened into a literary demonstrative meaning ‘this/thus’, while the original splitting sense lives on in derivatives like 撕 ‘to tear’.

examples.chinese: 斯人已逝(斯人已逝)，风骨长存(風骨長存)。
examples.pinyin: Sī rén yǐ shì, fēnggǔ chángcún.
examples.english: This person has passed away, but their integrity endures.

examples.chinese: 他在斯地求学多年(他在斯地求學多年)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài sī dì qiúxué duōnián.
examples.english: He studied in this place for many years.

examples.chinese: 我们将访问斯里兰卡(我們將訪問斯里蘭卡)。
